ingredients: 1 can (26 or 27 oz.) whole green chiles, drained (be careful not to buy whole jalapenos, which look similar)
1 can (15 oz.) black beans, rinsed well with cold water and drained
1 can (15 oz.) black beans, rinsed well with cold water and drained
1 lb. extra-lean ground beef (less than 10% fat)
1 T taco seasoning (I use my homemade Taco Seasoning, but a purchased seasoning will work.)
1 can (14.5 oz.) petite dice tomatoes with juice

1 cup Green Chile Enchilada Sauce (from a 15 oz. can, freeze the rest for another use.  If you need gluten-free be sure to choose a brand of green chile sauce that doesn't contain wheat.  One is La Victoria.)
1 1/2 cups Low-Fat Mexican Four Cheese Blend (I use the blend from Costco which has 6 grams of fat in 1/4 cup)
